snippet: Rates increased among almost all groups, a federal data analysis found, with women and middle-aged Americans hit particularly hard.
abstract: National Center for Health Statistics reports suicide in United States has hit almost 30-year peak, with increases in every age group except older adults; rise is markedly steep for women, and substantial among middle-aged Americans; overall suicide rate climbed 24 percent from 1999 to 2014, lifting rate to 13 per 100,000 people, highest since 1986.
lead_paragraph: Rates increased among almost all groups, a federal data analysis found, with women and middle-aged Americans hit particularly hard.

headline.main: U.S. Suicide Rate Surges to a 30-Year High
headline.print_headline: Sweeping Pain as Suicides Hit a 30-Year High
